Perfect! I can see the issue. The tests are using JUnit 4 annotations (`org.junit.Test`, `org.junit.Before`, `@RunWith`), but Spring Boot 3.3.4 (which is Java 17 compatible) uses JUnit 5 (Jupiter) by default. I need to migrate all test classes from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5.

# Java 8 to Java 17 Migration Summary

## Overview
This document summarizes the migration of the Spring Boot HelloWorld application from Java 8 to Java 17.

## Migration Date
2026-01-29

## Java Version
- **From:** Java 8
- **To:** Java 17 (OpenJDK 17.0.17)

## Spring Boot Version
- **Updated to:** Spring Boot 3.3.4 (requires Java 17+)

## Changes Made

### 1. POM.xml Updates
- ✅ Java version set to 17 in properties
- ✅ Maven compiler plugin configured for Java 17
- ✅ Spring Boot parent version: 3.3.4
- ✅ Removed deprecated `fork` configuration from spring-boot-maven-plugin
- ✅ Formatted and cleaned up compiler configuration

### 2. Test Framework Migration (JUnit 4 → JUnit 5)
All test classes were migrated from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5 (Jupiter):

#### ApplicationTests.java
- ❌ Removed: `import org.junit.Test`
- ❌ Removed: `import org.junit.runner.RunWith`
- ❌ Removed: `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)`
- ✅ Added: `import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`

#### HelloWorldControlerTests.java
- ❌ Removed: `import org.junit.Before`
- ❌ Removed: `import org.junit.Test`
- ❌ Removed: `import org.junit.runner.RunWith`
- ❌ Removed: `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)`
- ❌ Removed: Unused imports (MockServletContext, SpringJUnit4ClassRunner, WebAppConfiguration)
- ✅ Added: `import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach`
- ✅ Added: `import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`
- ✅ Changed: `@Before` → `@BeforeEach`

#### HelloTests.java
- ❌ Removed: `import org.junit.Before`
- ❌ Removed: `import org.junit.Test`
- ❌ Removed: `import org.junit.runner.RunWith`
- ❌ Removed: `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)`
- ❌ Removed: Unused imports (MockServletContext, SpringJUnit4ClassRunner, WebAppConfiguration)
- ✅ Added: `import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach`
- ✅ Added: `import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`
- ✅ Changed: `@Before` → `@BeforeEach`

### 3. Source Code
No changes were required to the main application code:
- `Application.java` - No changes needed
- `HelloWorldController.java` - No changes needed

## Build Verification

### Maven Build Status
```bash
mvn clean verify
```
**Result:** ✅ BUILD SUCCESS

### Test Results
- Tests run: 3
- Failures: 0
- Errors: 0
- Skipped: 0

**All tests passed successfully!**

## Key Migration Points

### JUnit 4 to JUnit 5 Mappings
| JUnit 4 | JUnit 5 (Jupiter) |
|---------|-------------------|
| `@Before` | `@BeforeEach` |
| `@After` | `@AfterEach` |
| `@BeforeClass` | `@BeforeAll` |
| `@AfterClass` | `@AfterAll` |
| `@Ignore` | `@Disabled` |
| `@RunWith` | `@ExtendWith` (not needed for @SpringBootTest) |
| `org.junit.*` | `org.junit.jupiter.api.*` |

### Spring Boot 3.x Changes
- Spring Boot 3.x requires Java 17 as minimum version
- JUnit 5 (Jupiter) is the default testing framework
- `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)` is no longer needed with `@SpringBootTest`
- Spring Boot 3.x uses Jakarta EE instead of javax namespace (not applicable to this simple project)

## Dependencies
All dependencies are managed by Spring Boot 3.3.4 parent POM:
- spring-boot-starter-web
- spring-boot-starter-test (includes JUnit 5)
- spring-boot-devtools

## Compatibility Notes
- ✅ All existing functionality preserved
- ✅ No breaking changes to application behavior
- ✅ Tests execute successfully with JUnit 5
- ✅ Build completes without warnings (except benign JVM sharing warning)

## Verification Commands
```bash
# Check Java version
java -version

# Clean build and run all tests
mvn clean verify

# Run tests only
mvn clean test

# Package application
mvn clean package
```

## Conclusion
The migration from Java 8 to Java 17 was completed successfully. The main changes involved:
1. Updating the POM.xml to target Java 17
2. Migrating test code from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5
3. Cleaning up deprecated configurations

The application builds and all tests pass successfully with Java 17 and Spring Boot 3.3.4.

# Quick Reference: JUnit 4 to JUnit 5 Migration

## Import Changes

### OLD (JUnit 4)
```java
import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.After;
import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
import org.springframework.test.context.junit4.SpringRunner;
```

### NEW (JUnit 5 / Jupiter)
```java
import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
import org.junit.jupiter.api.AfterEach;
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
// @RunWith not needed with @SpringBootTest in Spring Boot 3.x
```

## Annotation Changes

| JUnit 4 | JUnit 5 (Jupiter) |
|---------|-------------------|
| `@Before` | `@BeforeEach` |
| `@After` | `@AfterEach` |
| `@BeforeClass` | `@BeforeAll` |
| `@AfterClass` | `@AfterAll` |
| `@Ignore` | `@Disabled` |
| `@Category` | `@Tag` |

## Class Annotation Changes

### OLD (JUnit 4)
```java
@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)
@SpringBootTest
public class MyTest {
    // test methods
}
```

### NEW (JUnit 5)
```java
@SpringBootTest
public class MyTest {
    // test methods
}
```

## Setup Method Changes

### OLD (JUnit 4)
```java
@Before
public void setUp() {
    // setup code
}
```

### NEW (JUnit 5)
```java
@BeforeEach
public void setUp() {
    // setup code
}
```

## Assertion Changes (Optional)

JUnit 5 also changes the order of expected and actual in assertions:

### OLD (JUnit 4)
```java
import static org.junit.Assert.*;

assertEquals("expected", actual);
assertTrue(condition);
assertNull(object);
```

### NEW (JUnit 5 - Recommended)
```java
import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;

assertEquals("expected", actual);
assertTrue(condition);
assertNull(object);
```

**Note:** In this project, we kept using `org.springframework.test` assertion methods which work with both versions.

## Build Configuration

### Maven POM.xml
```xml
<properties>
    <java.version>17</java.version>
    <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
    <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
    <maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release>
</properties>

<parent>
    <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
    <version>3.3.4</version>
</parent>
```

## Key Points

1. **No @RunWith needed**: Spring Boot 3.x automatically configures JUnit 5, so `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)` is no longer needed.

2. **Package change**: All JUnit annotations moved from `org.junit.*` to `org.junit.jupiter.api.*`

3. **Backwards compatibility**: Most test logic remains the same; only imports and annotations need to be updated.

4. **Spring Boot 3.x requirement**: Spring Boot 3.x requires Java 17+ and uses JUnit 5 by default.

## Common Migration Pattern

For each test class:

1. Replace imports:
   - `org.junit.*` → `org.junit.jupiter.api.*`
   
2. Remove:
   - `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)` (when using `@SpringBootTest`)
   - Unused imports (SpringJUnit4ClassRunner, etc.)

3. Update annotations:
   - `@Before` → `@BeforeEach`
   - `@After` → `@AfterEach`
   - `@BeforeClass` → `@BeforeAll`
   - `@AfterClass` → `@AfterAll`

4. Keep everything else the same!

## Build Commands

```bash
# Clean and compile
mvn clean compile

# Run tests
mvn test

# Full build with verification
mvn clean verify

# Package application
mvn clean package
```

## Troubleshooting

### Issue: "package org.junit does not exist"
**Solution:** You're still using JUnit 4 imports. Change to `org.junit.jupiter.api.*`

### Issue: "cannot find symbol: class RunWith"
**Solution:** Remove `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)` - it's not needed in Spring Boot 3.x with JUnit 5

### Issue: "cannot find symbol: class Before"
**Solution:** Change `@Before` to `@BeforeEach` and import from `org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach`

## Resources

- [JUnit 5 User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/)
- [Spring Boot Testing Documentation](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/reference/html/features.html#features.testing)
- [Migrating from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#migrating-from-junit4)
